DataElement.preferredName: Collection Specimen Anticoagulant Agent Additive Used Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of anticoagulant used at the time of sample collection, not included in the enumerated list.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Collection Specimen Anticoagulant Agent Additive Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation._A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Property.preferredDefinition: Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
